lexUnit.name: resign.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: voluntarily leave a job or position of office.

sentence.text: A top advisory body to China 's communist party met on Friday , one day after senior leader Deng Xiaoping resigned from the party military commission , defying speculation of a further shake-up in the leadership .
Many officers resigned their commissions to take up jobs with the new company .

He will resign if he is forced to accept an unrealistic budget he can not commit to .
But others of us who were Governors were so opposed to it that we all said we 'd resign from the governing body if the school did opt out .
` I resigned my post , " she finally replied .
He resigned from his Egyptian government posts on May 15 .
Guillermo Ford Boyd resigned his post as Planning and Economic Policy Minister , it was reported locally on Aug. 28 , but remained Second Vice-President .
Garcia resigned his seat in January 1990 , shortly before the two were sentenced to three years ' imprisonment .

Vice chairman Alan Noble resigned his seat on the board because of business commitments , but that was n't the last of him .

The pilots resigned six weeks ago when the airlines refused a demand by the Australian Federation of Air Pilots for direct negotiations over their claim for a 29.5 per cent pay rise .

De Gaulle resigned after two months as head of the first Government of the Fourth Republic -- a regime that had 25 governments in 12 years ( 1946-58 ) .

Mrs Thatcher 's direct , even confrontational style of managing the Cabinet became an issue in the circumstances in which Michael Heseltine resigned in January 1986 .

Two senior scientists have resigned from leading British conservation bodies in protest at the government 's interference , which they claimed undermined their independence and the quality of advice on conservation available to them .
